ABOUT_CONTENT:
The Citizen Initiative Portal rahvaalgatus.ee enables you to write proposals, hold discussions, compose and send digitally signed collective addresses to the Estonian Parliament (Riigikogu). At rahvaalgatus.ee you can submit a proposal to the Riigikogu on how to amend existing regulations or improve the society. A collective address should have at least 1000 signatures in support, given by at least 16 year old citizens of Estonia. At rahvaalgatus.ee you can follow the proceeding of the address in the parliament and whether it will become a draft act. 

Collective petitioning right emerged from the People’s Assembly process – since 2014 spring every citizen can send collective initiatives to the Parliament for consideration. According to the law, the Parliament will have to process appeals that have at least 1000 signatures. During the period from spring 2014 until beginning of 2016, the Parliament has processed 11 collective initiatives and two of them have been made into laws.

Who should use rahvaalgatus.ee? 
- citizens interested in societal issues for creating discussions and initiatives   
- advocacy organisations for creating discussions and initiatives 
- citizens interested in participating in discussions and in co-creating collective initiatives 
- people willing to support initiatives with their digital sinature  

Who else benefits from rahvaalgatus.ee?  
- members of the Riigikogu and other politicians in order to keep up with discussions being held and proposals being submitted 
- representatives of ministries in order to keep up with propositions made in their fields  
- journalists for reflecting on discussions and initiatives gaining big public attention, also for following the political discussions in the parliament 

Rahvaalgatus.ee portal will be created by the Estonian Cooperation Assembly in close cooperation with the Chancellery of the Riigikogu. The portal is created on the freeware for community decision-making — CitizenOS.com — which is set up by the foundation Lets Do It! The citizen initiative portal is one of the activities in the Estonian Action Plan 2014-2016 of the Open Government Partnership.
HOME_WELCOME_TITLE: Welcome to the home of citizen initiatives!
HOME_WELCOME:
Do you feel like some things could be done better in Estonia? Or that some regulations could be changed? 
Rahvaalgatus.ee enables you to compile and send collective addresses - with at least 1000 digital dignatures - to the parliament of Estonia. Also, you can follow whether your proposal will be turned into draft act.
BTN_NEW_TOPIC: CREATE A DISCUSSION OR AN INITIATIVE
DISCUSSION_CONTENT: Here you get an overview of all discussions that are going on and that have been finished already. If you want to join a discussion, click on the title of that  discussion.
INITIATIVE_CONTENT: Here you get an overview of all initiatives that are being co-created or that are waiting for supporters' signatures. If you want to contribute with your thoughts or digital signature, click on the title of the initiative of your interest.
SUPPORT_US_CONTENT:
The platform rahvaalgatus.ee is being set up with public funding, but still, in order to keep the platform running and to guarantee the quality of discussions and initiatives,  we need support from users. Any kind of donation - 5, 50 or 500 euros - is very welcome! 
The donated money helps to cover digital signing costs, ensure technical help and safety of the platform as well as enables to advise the authors of discussions and initiatives. 

Soon here will be a convenient way to make donations, but until then you can support the platform using the following information:  

receiver of the donation: Rahandusministeerium (Ministry of Finance of Estonia) 
account number: EE731010220027689012
reference number: 3500081076
explanation: rahvaalgatus
  
The receiver of the donation is the foundation Estonian Cooperation Assembly, who uses donations for maintaining the platform of rahvaalgatus.ee.
CO_AUTHORS_TEXT: A good discussion springs from many heads. Here you can invite co-authors to join a discussion or create an initiative, using their name or e-mail address. Co-authors have the same rights as you do. You can also add co-authors later, once the discussion or initiative is in full speed already.
EXPLANATION: Create a discussion or an initiative
EXPLANATION_CONTENT:
Good initiatives stem from good discussions. We suggest you to start with creating a discussion: submit your idea and explain it, then invite others to join the discussion, and in the fullness of time create an initiative on the basis of the discussion, co-edit it with others, collect digital signatures to the co-created initiative and submit it to the parliament with just few clicks. 
The service for creating discussions and initiatives is free of charge, but donations for maintaining the platform are very welcome.
CONFIRM_I_HAVE_READ: Please confirm you have read and agree with the terms of using the platform.
I_HAVE_READ: I have read and agree with the
LOGIN_TO_CREATE_TOPIC: You need to log in in order to create a discussion or an initiative!
START_DISCUSSION: CREATE A DISCUSSION TO GET MORE FEEDBACK FOR YOUR PROPOSAL
POST_INITIATIVE: POST AN INITIATIVE TO GATHER SIGNATURES
YOU_CAN_STILL_CHANGE_DEADLINE: You can change the deadline you set, if needed during the discussion or initiative.
DEADLINE_EXPLANATION: A good discussion does not last for ever. Set a time frame for your discussion or initiative by choosing a deadline from the calendar. The deadline will appear on the timeline of the discussion/initiative.
DEADLINE_EXPLANATION_DISCUSSION: A good discussion does not last for ever. Set a time frame for your discussion by choosing a deadline from the calendar. The deadline will appear on the timeline of the discussion.
DEADLINE_EXPLANATION_INITIATIVE: To boost your campaign and motivate supporters to act quickly, set timeframe for your initiative: choose a deadline from the calendar. The deadline will appear on the timeline of the initiative.
YOU_CAN_STILL_CHANGE_DEADLINE_DISCUSSION: You can change the deadline you set, if needed during the discussion.
YOU_CAN_STILL_CHANGE_DEADLINE_INITIATIVE: You can change the deadline you set, if needed during the initiative.
SET_DEADLINE_FOR_SIGNATURE_COLLECTING: Set the deadline for collecting signatures
HEADING_CAST_YOUR_VOTE: Cast your vote to this initiative!
HEADING_VOTE_REQUIRE_HARD_ID: You can sign with the help of an ID card or mobile ID. You cannot sign without identifying yourself.
WANT_TO_KEEP_INFORMED_ABOUT_FURTHER_PROG: Want to be informed about further progress?
SENT_TO_PARLIAMENT: The initiative has been sent to Riigikogu!
SENT_TO_PARLIAMENT_CONTENT:
The initiative has been sent to Riigikogu! 
The parliament has 30 days to decide whether to process the initiative. If the initiative corresponds to the criteria of collective addresses, the Chancellery of the Riigikogu will inform the author of the initiative about which commission will discuss the initiative. This information will be public on rahvaalgatus.ee as well. 
If the initiative moves to next processing phase, the author(s) of the initiative can add new phases and information from the OPTIONS menu.
AT_LEAST_1000_SIGNATURES_COLLECTED: At least 1000 signatures were collected. You can now send this initiative to the parliament.
HEADING_ARE_YOU_SURE: Are you sure you want to continue?
TXT_NO_UNDO: Please keep in mind you cannot undo this action.
MSG_ERROR_INVALID_PHONE_NUMBER: Invalid phone number. Please enter your phone number with the country code: +372 xxx xxxx.
TXT_MOBILEID_CHECK_CONTROL_CODE_PIN1: Make sure the control code matches with the one on your phone screen and enter PIN1 code for your mobile ID.
TXT_TOPIC_BECOMES_UNEDITABLE: The discussion of this topic will close, it's content can no longer be edited.
TXT_VOTING_ENDS: Voting will end, further voting will not be possible.
TXT_ALL_VERSIONS_OF_TOPIC_DELETED: All versions of the discussion will be deleted.
TXT_ALL_DISCUSSIONS_AND_VOTES_DELETED: All discussions and votes will be deleted.
TXT_TOPIC_WILL_BE_REMOVED_FROM_GROUPS_AN: The discussion will be removed from groups and categories.
TXT_TOPIC_ACCESS_REMOVED: You cannot participate in the discussion anymore.
TXT_TOPIC_ACCESS_ADMIN_CAN_ADD_BACK: The administrator of the discussion can add you back later if needed.
BTN_NO_LEAVE: NO, DO NOT LEAVE THE DISCUSSION
TXT_INVITE_PEOPLE: Invite people you want to join the discussion
OR_INVITE: or invite them via their profile or e-mail
ADD_OPTIONAL_MESSAGE_FOR_INVITE: Add an optional message for the invitee(s)
SET_HASTAG_FOR_TOPIC: Set a hashtag for this discussion or initiative
HASHTAG_TEXT: Hashtags are used in social media to collect data and messages. Use this hashtag in Facebook or Twitter and it will show in the social mentions under the discussion/initiative.

MSG_ERROR_40010_TOPIC: You cannot leave this topic as you are the last user with administrator permissions. To leave, please assign a new administrator to this discussion or initiative.
MSG_ERROR_40030_VOTE: Personal identification code is already connected to another user account. Signing initiatives with the same code from different user accounts is not allowed.

MSG_ERROR_HWCRYPTO_NO_CERTIFICATES: No card in reader. Check if the ID card is inserted correctly to the reader. New ID cards have chip on the back side of the card.

HOME_VIDEO_TEXT: You can make proposals to the Estonian parliament through rahvaalgatus.ee (VIDEO)
PLEASE_FILL_EMAIL: Please also fill in your e-mail address
KEEP ME INFORMED (algatuse uudiskirja te:
There has been a following progress in the discussion or initiative named [title]: [name of the milestone]. 
[authors of the discussion/initiative]

You have subscribed to receiving updates on rahvaalgatus.ee. Click here if you want to unsubscribe.
SIGNING_INFO: If there are problems with digital signing, please check from id.ee whether your ID-software is up to date. If you have problems with digital signing only at rahvaalgatus.ee, then please click the ?-button in the right corner of the website, so that we could fix the error.
DEAR_USER_CONTENT: Rahvaalgatus.ee is in beta version and improves with every hour. Please help us to develop the platform further by sending feedback or reporting errors by clicking on the “?”-button in the corner of the page.”
SIGNATURE_COLLECTION_END_NOT_ENOUGH:
Collecting signatures has ended. You cannot sign this initiatives anymore. Since the initiative did not get the necessary minimum amount (1000 signatures) by the set deadline, the initiative is stopped by authors.
Rahvaalgatus.ee keeps the collected signatures for one year in case the initiative will be re-opened for signing.
SIGNATURE_COLLECTION_END_SUCCESS:
Collecting signatures has ended successfully! You cannot sign this initiative anymore. 
Next the authors of the initiative will send the initiative along with collected signatures to the Parliament of Estonia. 
Since the parliament can process the initiative for a while, we recommend you to order notifications for this initiative "Keep me informed".
NOT_ENOUGH_SIGNATURES: We're sorry but you didn't collect enough signatures before your set deadline. You can reopen the topic, set a new deadline and collect more signatures.
ARE_YOU_SURE_SEND_TO_PARLIAMENT:
Are you sure you want to send the initiative to parliament? 
The Chancellery of the Riigikogu will perform identity inspection for everyone who has given signature to your initiative. It can turn out that some signatures are not valid (because the person is under 16 years or non-resident). Therefore we suggest to gather at least 1050 signatures and then send the initiative to Riigikogu.
TXT_TOPIC_COMMENT_LOG_IN_TO_PARTICIPATE: You need to log in to participate.
CHOOSE_DEADLINE_TO_CONTINUE: To continue, choose a date from the calendar on the right!
